feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches possible. Lighter snow amounts for Gustavus and Hoonah regions. Higher snow totals for Juneau, Petersburg, and Wrangell.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 3:53PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE SUSITNA VALLEY MONDAY... Snow is expected to develop Monday morning across much of the Susitna Valley. The snow is expected to start off as wet snow before transitioning to a drier, more powdery snow by Monday afternoon or evening. Snowfall rates are also expected to increase late Monday, especially for Talkeetna south to Willow (including

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 4:06AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated water levels along the West Coast Sunday and Monday... A strong weather system moving to the West Coast will bring elevated water levels to the coast south of the Bering Strait Sunday night and Monday and north of the Bering Strait on Monday. entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 2:26AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORMY WEATHER RETURNS WITH TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 2:26AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORMY WEATHER RETURNS WITH TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.

Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. * WHERE...Uniontown, Colfax, Pullman, and Oakesdale. Mainly along and east of Highway 195. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 2:38AM MST until December 20 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Freezing drizzle, freezing fog, and light snow. * WHERE...In Wyoming, Sheridan Foothills. In Montana, Southern Big Horn. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST this morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 1:11AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Some Dense Fog... Some dense fog will continue during the early morning hours across northeast Wyoming into the northern Black Hills and foothills. This has impacted Interstate 90 across northeast Wyoming to Sturgis South Dakota. Visibilities will be less than one half mile at times and it will
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 19 at 10:42PM MST until December 21 at 5:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH WIND WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible Monday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 19 at 10:42PM MST until December 21 at 5:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH WIND WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible Monday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 9:57PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Dense Fog Reducing Visibility Tonight... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Areas of dense fog. Visibility will be greatly reduced and roadways may be slick with temperatures below freezing. * WHERE...Cody Foothills.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 9:57PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Dense Fog Reducing Visibility Tonight... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Areas of dense fog. Visibility will be greatly reduced and roadways may be slick with temperatures below freezing. * WHERE...Johnson County.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued December 19 at 7:55PM MST until December 21 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO 8 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts 60 to 75 mph expected. * WHERE...Cody Foothills. This high wind event could produce similar peak wind gusts at both Cody and Clark.
